indiscriminate.中释: 不分皂白的, 不加选择的
indiscriminate.英释: an indiscriminate action is done without thinking about what harm it might cause

unconscionable.中释: 不合理的, 不受良心节制的, 过度的
unconscionable.英释: much more than is reasonable or acceptable

irreconcilable.中释: 不能协调的, 矛盾的
irreconcilable.英释: irreconcilable positions etc are so strongly opposed to each other that it is not possible for them to reach an agreement

incommensurate.中释: 不相称的, 不适应的

hypersensitive.中释: 非常敏感的, 敏感的
hypersensitive.英释: if someone is hypersensitive to a drug, substance etc, their body reacts very badly to it

impressionable.中释: 容易受感动的, 敏感的
impressionable.英释: someone who is impressionable is easily influenced, especially because they are young

discriminating.中释: 识别的, 有差别的, 有识别力的
discriminating.英释: able to judge what is of good quality and what is not

irreproachable.中释: 无可指责的, 不可非难的, 无缺点的, 无过失的
irreproachable.英释: something, such as someone’s behaviour, that is irreproachable is so good that you cannot criticize it

transcendental.中释: 先验的, 超越的, 超出人类经验的
transcendental.英释: transcendental experiences or ideas are beyond normal human understanding and experience

disciplinarian.中释: 训练的, 规律的, 训育的

discriminatory.中释: 有辨识力的, 有差别的

claustrophobia.英释: a strong fear of being in a small enclosed space or in a situation that limits what you can do

identification.中释: 辨认, 鉴定, 证明, 视为同一
identification.英释: official papers or cards, such as your passport, that prove who you are

philanthropist.英释: a rich person who gives a lot of money to help poor people

classification.英释: a process in which you put something into the group or class it belongs to

photosynthesis.英释: the production by a green plant of special substances like sugar that it uses as food, caused by the action of sunlight on  chlorophyll (= the green substance in leaves )

reconciliation.中释: 和解, 调和, 顺从
reconciliation.英释: a situation in which two people, countries etc become friendly with each other again after quarrelling

verisimilitude.英释: the quality of being true or real

circumlocution.英释: the practice of using too many words to express an idea, instead of saying it directly

psychoanalysis.英释: medical treatment that involves talking to someone about their life, feelings etc in order to find out the hidden causes of their problems

predisposition.英释: a tendency to behave in a particular way or suffer from a particular illness

presupposition.英释: something that you think is true, although you have no proof

reconnaissance.中释: 侦察, 搜索, 勘测
reconnaissance.英释: the military activity of sending soldiers and aircraft to find out about the enemy’s forces
